poem:
### In the Echo of Conflict

A strike once traced,  
in Mezzah's shadowed lanes,  
dust where windows danced  
with evening's murmured breath.  
Echoes cradle cries—  
a city's heartbeat falters,  
while fractured dawn tells stories  
stained with silent names.  
Walls whisper grief,  
and in shattered stones,  
the shifting air remembers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Netanyahu says Israel has ‘taken out’ Nasrallah’s successors and warns Lebanon faces destruction ‘like Gaza’ 6.56pm BST Israeli strike targets Damascus residential building – Syrian state media An Israeli strike targeted a residential building in the Mezzah suburb west of Damascus, Syria’s state news agency reported. Preliminary reports indicated that the strike had resulted in injuries among civilians, according to state media, Reuters reported. Earlier state media reports said Syrian air". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
